Description: Cleopatra and Octavian; the Queen of Egypt stands on the left, her servants huddled behind her while their mistress pleads with Octavian, who stands on the right, followed by two soldiers; a bust of Caesar stands between them; illustration to the 1754 edition of Charles Rollin's 'The Ancient History of the Egyptians, Carthaginians, Assyrians, Babylonians, Medes, and Persians' (first published in London: Knapton, 1738-1740); working proof, with horizontal lines added on the floor and in the oculi in the upper section; before letter. c.1738/40 Etching
Producer name: Print made by: Jacques Philippe Le Bas
Bibliographic references: IFF / Inventaire du Fonds Français: Bibliothèque Nationale, Département des Estampes (not described) (Gravelot; Le Bas)
Associated titles: The Ancient History of the Egyptians, Carthaginians, Assyrians, Babylonians, Medes, and Persians
Acquisition notes: 1857,0217.83 to 166 is a collection of prints by and after Gravelot, purchased as one lot in an unidentified sale at Puttick Simpson by Graves on behalf of the BM.
